title: Index of a subgroup
summary: In mathematics, specifically group theory, the index of a subgroup H in a group G is the number of left cosets of H in G, or equivalently, the number of right cosets of H in G. The index is denoted | G : H | {\displaystyle |G:H|} or [ G : H ] {\displaystyle [G:H]} or ( G : H ) {\displaystyle (G:H)} .
